messageBody:
I just read the javassist article on developerworks:
http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-dyn0916.html

This gave me the tool to do something I have been meaning to try
for a long time: introduce a mock class as an imposter of the
thing it is mocking using a special classloader.

This technique gives the following advantages:
o final classes can be mocked
o final methods can be mocked
o the mock only has to implement methods that will ever get called
o don't need to refactor the code to introduce interfaces, factories
etc.

I have uploaded my example to the files section. It replaces my previous
reloading classloader example.

- Neil Swingler
